main.name: Parimal Mehta
main.description: I am an enthusiastic developer with over a year of experience and an always learning mindset
bio: Born in Boston and growing up in Ahmedabad, I have gained a well-rounded education and a strong programming foundation. I am particularly fond of Java - my first language and Python for its flexibility. Besides coding, I am also a voracious reader of sci-fi, fantasy, and mystery novels.
objective: I am a quick study and a detail-oriented individual seeking to solve real problems, contribute to company goals, and make the lives of people better. I am looking for an opportunity where I can learn a lot and work collaboratively with an enthusiastic and dynamic team on next-level technology.

education.degree: Bachelor of Technology in Computer Engineering
description: Clubs: Society of Automotive Engineers(SAE) and Association of Computer Engineering Students(ACES).
CGPA: 8.00/10 GRE: 332 TOEFL: 114
Through college, I have been introduced to a breadth of experiences including internships, research, online courses, and team-based competitions.
Responsibilities: Head Boy(2014-15), House Prefect(2012-13)
I gained a strong foundation in the sciences, mathematics, and computer science at school. I was taught Java and OOP concepts here.
I achieved a score of 97% in 12th grade. With this, I attained the 1st Rank in Gujarat(state-wide) and 10th Rank All-India(nation-wide) for the ISC Board Exams - 2016.

courses.title: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
courses.description: Dynamic Programming, Assignment Problem, Traveling Salesman

certifications.title: Programming for the Web with JavaScript
Programming for Everybody(Getting Started with Python)

work.title: Software Engineering Co-op
description: Redesigning the 834 file validation process(written in PL/SQL) for Member Enrollment.
Developing an operational dashboard to display metrics from various security tools in one place.
Using SharePoint to automate CCA's manual invoicing process.
Coding features and testing the new Intranet and the new Provider Directory.

work.title: Application Development Intern
description: Blecan Innovations is the legal narrative for a point of interaction system(POIS). One of its many applications includes walkout payments. It is based at the GUSEC Incubator.
I learned React.js and Redux and applied this knowledge to develop modules for their restaurant management system.
I helped code and design the Owner Panel, Manager Panel, Kitchen Panel, Order Panel, a dynamic Menu Display, Employee Management Panel, and Discount Panel.

Some components I worked on include the Shopping Cart module, a Search Bar for the Menu, a Live Orders module (with numbered Order Cards and an Order popup to list food items) for the Kitchen Panel, and a Statistics (Revenue, No of Orders, etc.) display for the Owner Panel.
I integrated the frontend with the backend using HTTP requests for existing Python APIs.

work.title: Product Development Intern
description: I was in the top 1% (21st rank at the national level) of students to give the Intro to Modern Application Development (IMAD) MOOC Exam by NPTEL, 2017.
Based on this, I was one of 400 students selected from around India to be part of the Hasura Product Development Fellowship 2018.

We were divided into teams of 4 and allocated a project to develop. Our project was a Currency Conversion ChatBot Mobile App. Before starting development, we made application wireframes to be evaluated by our mentor. I was the main front-end developer and designed the complete UI.

I led and coordinated my team to build the app using React-Native and Python-Flask. We integrated an API for currency conversion and used DialogFlow for Natural Language Processing of user inputs. We further used Hasura servers to host a webhook to connect DialogFlow with the API. We also tested the app with various use cases.
Our entire team got the High Performer/Distinguished Fellow Award for our work.
We further got the chance to write an article about our work on Expo Blog on Medium.

work.title: Web Development Trainee
description: This two week internship/training was my first foray into Web Development.

I learned how to use HTML, CSS, PHP and Bootstrap. Then, I downloaded a personal profile template and used my newly learnt skills to personalise the template. Finally, I deployed my website onto the company servers using the FTP client - Filezilla.

research.title: Student Researcher
description: I am currently doing research in the fields of Blockchain and UAVs, under the guidance of Dr. Sudeep Tanwar.

I was previously trying to find ways that the distributed and security-oriented nature of Blockchain technology can help solve various issues in UAV networks like eavesdropping or data alteration. I was also reading about 5G networks to see how they can improve UAV networks in terms of reliability and latency. A survey paper on this topic was published in Computer Communications.
I have also worked on an implementation paper for UAV-based deliveries for the healthcare industry which is being published in the upcoming DroneCom 2020.

research.title: Visiting Researcher
description: I was 1 of 10 undergraduate students selected to be part of the Robotics and Autonomous Systems REU at USC Viterbi School of Engineering sponsored by the NSF.

I worked in Dr. Maja MatariÄ‡'s Interaction Lab on a project related to Infant-Robot Interaction using Socially Assistive Robotics to reduce Developmental Delay. I worked with the Sphero Robot using ROS, Python, Socket programming, Computer Vision and C++.

I also worked on using Natural Language Processing, Amazon Polly, and the Kiwi Robot for Human-Robot Interaction to teach people Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) through storytelling. I have worked with the GPT-2 model for keyword-based text generation.

volunteer.institute: Vaudeville - Nirma University's Annual Cultural Festival
volunteer.title: Event Head
description: I helped manage 3 events : Face Painting, Fashion from Waste and One Line Drawing at Vaudeville - Nirma University's Cultural Festival.

I helped develop the event, collect the materials for it, arrange the location, communicate with the participants, coordinate with the volunteers and judges, proctor the actual event and distribute the certificates and prizes.
We had a footfall of 50+ people.

volunteer.institute: B. Tech 1st Year Students Orientation - Nirma University
volunteer.title: Anchor
description: I was one of 20 people from the Institute of Technology, who was an anchor during the week long 2018 B.Tech 1st Year Orientation Program for 800+ new students.

volunteer.title: Event Management
description: I helped manage various events at NU-Tech'18 - Nirma University's National Level Tech-Fest.
I was an invigilator, judge and ticket checker for these events.
They had a combined footfall of 150+ people.

volunteer.title: Member of Executive Committee
description: I spread awareness about Nirma University's National Level Tech-Fest in nearby colleges. I helped attract and register 50+ people for multiple events.

volunteer.institute: Society for Research and Initiatives for Sustainable Technologies and Institutions (SRISTI)
volunteer.title: Volunteer
description: The BIRAC-SRISTI GYTI Awards distributes INR 325 lakh every year to nurture grass root level innovations at the college level for entrepreneurship.
I was part of the team which did the Pre-Final Review and Data Collection for the BIRAC-SRISTI GYTI Awards 2018.

volunteer.institute: Bharat Lokhit Seva Samiti - Chinmay Institute
volunteer.title: Volunteer
description: I interacted and played with the underprivileged children at the institute.

volunteer.title: IMAD Student Ambassador
description: I spread awareness about the Introduction to Modern Application Development (IMAD) MOOC by NPTEL and Hasura in the student community (over 15+ colleges in my state).

projects.title: A Movie Information ChatBot
description: It will give information about a movie to the user based on what they have asked.
It uses the OMDb API to get data and DialogFlow to understand and reply to user queries.

projects.title: KiTicket - Movie Ticket Booking System
description: A Movie Ticket Booking System using Java Swing and the Java Derby Database.
It has features like OTP authentication, database management, and a booking GUI.

projects.title: CConvert - Currency Converting ChatBot
description: Made for the Hasura Product Development Fellowship(HPDF) in 2018

publications.title: Blockchain envisioned UAV networks: Challenges, solutions, and comparisons
description: A survey paper on how the distributed and security-oriented nature of Blockchain technology can be used to help solve various issues in 5G-enabled UAV networks.

publications.title: 'VAHAK: A Blockchain-based Outdoor Delivery Scheme using UAV for Healthcare 4.0 Services
description: This implementation paper is about blockchain-based drones for emergency deliveries.

publications.title: Basics of Autonomous Navigation
description: I have written a seminar paper which gives a brief overview of the concept known as autonomous navigation. It tries to give a summary of the general concept, software used, hardware, its applications and the algorithms working behind the scenes-SLAM( Simultaneous Localisation and Mapping) in an understandable manner.

competitions.title: Association for Unmanned Vehicle Systems International Student Unmanned Aerial Systems Competition(AUVSI SUAS)
description: I participate as a part of Team Arrow - Nirma University's Aero Design Team.
I am working on various tasks for Team Arrow which participates in the AUVSI-SUAS competitions held in Maryland, USA every year.

In addition to managing the software team, I work on the interoperability system which gets commands from the competition server and uploads them to our UAV with minimal user interaction. I also focus on obstacle avoidance.
Results: Team Arrow came 35th of 75 teams at the AUVSI-SUAS 2019.

competitions.title: International Computer Programming Competition(ICPC)
description: Won at school level.

competitions.title: Gesture Robotics Workshop
description: Used Arduino to program a robot built with a DIY kit and controlled by an Android app.
My team won the 3rd prize at the same.

competitions.title: Anand Niketan Model United Nations(ANMUN)
description: Journalist and Participant

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
